heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 34.3mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (192°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 1.0 mm), cloud levels (up 211 m), feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 73.1m lower than yesterday, 211.4m lower than the past week, 196.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 523m and a peak of 933m, averaging 571.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and the light is absent. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
